programme.title: Christmas with the Kranks
Święta Last Minute
Christmas with the Kranks
programme.desc: Christmas with the Kranks: Directed by Joe Roth. With Tim Allen, Jamie Lee Curtis, Dan Aykroyd, M. Emmet Walsh. With their daughter, Blair, away, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0388419/","name":"Christmas with the Kranks","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMDMxODEwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzM4OTc2._V1_.jpg","description":"With their daughter, Blair, away, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0388419/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"the-movie-guy"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Have a Merry slapstick Christmas","reviewBody":"For the first time, Luther Krank (Tim Allen) and his wife Nora (Jamie Lee Curtis) are about to celebrate the holidays without their daughter Blair (Julie Gonzalo), who has just left for the Peace Corps in Peru. Luther sees a Caribbean cruise poster in a Chicago travel agency window, and he begins to plan the trip. First he must see how he will pay for the trip, so he comes up with an idea that if they skipped Christmas, they could go. He will save money by not buying a tree, having a party, or putting up decorations. The neighbors think he is crazy and want him to at least put Frosty the Snowman on his roof for the local decoration contest. The battle begins between the Kranks and their neighbors. Then Blair calls and tells her parents that she is flying home for Christmas with her fiancée. They have twenty-four hours to put up all the decorations and prepare for the Christmas party. The movie was based on a John Grisham book, 'Skipping Christmas'. It is a cute Christmas story with a lot of funny slapstick sketches. It reminds you of the Chevy Chase movie, 'National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation'. Tim Allen does a great job in several comedy scenes, especially, the scenes where he gets bowtox injections in his face and the suntan scene. (Columbia Pictures, Run time 1:39, Rated PG) (5/10)"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45929,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-11-24","keywords":"bikini,christmas,cat,singing,arrest","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Christmas with the Kranks","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2092826905","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0MTdmNTItZTQwMC00MTk5LTkyZTYtYjdjMGNkMzBkZjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0MTdmNTItZTQwMC00MTk5LTkyZTYtYjdjMGNkMzBkZjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000741/","name":"Tim Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005387/","name":"Joe Roth"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125564/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001300/","name":"John Grisham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Shrek the Third
Shrek Trzeci
Shrek the Third
programme.desc:
Shrek the Third: Directed by Chris Miller, Raman Hui. With Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz, Antonio Banderas. Reluctantly designated as the heir to the land of Far, Far Away, Shrek hatches a plan to install the rebellious Artie as the new king while Princess Fiona tries to fend off a coup d'état by the jilted Prince Charming." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0413267/","name":"Shrek the Third","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTgyMjc3ODk2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjY0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Reluctantly designated as the heir to the land of Far, Far Away, Shrek hatches a plan to install the rebellious Artie as the new king while Princess Fiona tries to fend off a coup d'état by the jilted Prince Charming.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0413267/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pschwebe"},"dateCreated":"2007-05-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"The movie that rates itself: The Third.","reviewBody":"Paul McCartney is a great songwriter. Let me just get that out of the way. But he isn't perfect. Take for example the song, "Live and Let Die", a song he wrote in the '70s for a Bond movie of the same name. The song is used briefly in Dreamworks' latest outing for everyone's favorite Scots ogre. In the song he actually wrote this line: "But if in this ever changing world in which we live in". "In which we live in"? Was he kidding? A great talent, but that is some lazy songwriting. I figure he was either exhausted, or under contract, as opposed to being inspired.

And that's the problem with this entire movie. The writing is simply not up to par. The story is loaded down with so many different elements that it is impossible to develop any of them. You can almost see the writers thinking, "Okay, now we've got a bunch of stuff for Shrek, Donkey, and Puss to do. Let's put in some stuff for Fiona and Lillian here..." The result is that there's a script, but no real story. And the dialog with some exceptions, is full of the clichés they so happily lampooned in earlier Shreks. The result comes across as a 3rd or 4th draft. 

Andrew Adamson directed the previous two Shreks and has one of the writing credits here, but he did not direct it. I guess the franchise is so important now that it must be handled by two directors, neither of whom has Adamson's knack for timing. At various points in the evening, the pace was surprisingly ponderous.

It's not unpleasant, as movies go. It's just disappointing when such an average film continues a series of such good ones.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":293205,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2007-06-06","keywords":"shrek,king,puss in boots,donkey,kingdom","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Shrek the Third","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1484980505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmI0NmI0MTItYzIzNy00YzcwLTk3ZmItZDU0MTAyM2JjOGRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmI0NmI0MTItYzIzNy00YzcwLTk3ZmItZDU0MTAyM2JjOGRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Dreamworks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000196/","name":"Mike Myers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1844237/","name":"Chris Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0401203/","name":"Raman Hui"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040938/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069464/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0696949/","name":"Jeffrey Price"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780620/","name":"Peter S. IMDb data; ttnr: 0413267, Title: Shrek the Third, --- Description: Shrek the Third: Directed by Chris Miller, Raman Hui. With Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz, Antonio Banderas. Reluctantly designated as the heir to the land of Far, Far Away, Shrek hatches a plan to install the rebellious Artie as the new king while Princess Fiona tries to fend off a coup d'état by the jilted Prince Charming." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0413267/","name":"Shrek the Third","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTgyMjc3ODk2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjY0MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Reluctantly designated as the heir to the land of Far, Far Away, Shrek hatches a plan to install the rebellious Artie as the new king while Princess Fiona tries to fend off a coup d'état by the jilted Prince Charming.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0413267/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"pschwebe","dateCreated":"2007-05-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"The movie that rates itself: The Third.","reviewBody":"Paul McCartney is a great songwriter. Let me just get that out of the way. But he isn't perfect. Take for example the song, "Live and Let Die", a song he wrote in the '70s for a Bond movie of the same name. The song is used briefly in Dreamworks' latest outing for everyone's favorite Scots ogre. In the song he actually wrote this line: "But if in this ever changing world in which we live in". "In which we live in"? Was he kidding? A great talent, but that is some lazy songwriting. I figure he was either exhausted, or under contract, as opposed to being inspired.

And that's the problem with this entire movie. The writing is simply not up to par. The story is loaded down with so many different elements that it is impossible to develop any of them. You can almost see the writers thinking, "Okay, now we've got a bunch of stuff for Shrek, Donkey, and Puss to do. Let's put in some stuff for Fiona and Lillian here..." The result is that there's a script, but no real story. And the dialog with some exceptions, is full of the clichés they so happily lampooned in earlier Shreks. The result comes across as a 3rd or 4th draft. 

Andrew Adamson directed the previous two Shreks and has one of the writing credits here, but he did not direct it. I guess the franchise is so important now that it must be handled by two directors, neither of whom has Adamson's knack for timing. At various points in the evening, the pace was surprisingly ponderous.

It's not unpleasant, as movies go. It's just disappointing when such an average film continues a series of such good ones.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":293205,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2007-06-06","keywords":"shrek,king,puss in boots,donkey,kingdom","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Shrek the Third","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1484980505","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmI0NmI0MTItYzIzNy00YzcwLTk3ZmItZDU0MTAyM2JjOGRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmI0NmI0MTItYzIzNy00YzcwLTk3ZmItZDU0MTAyM2JjOGRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Dreamworks","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000196/","name":"Mike Myers","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1844237/","name":"Chris Miller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0401203/","name":"Raman Hui"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040938/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069464/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0696949/","name":"Jeffrey Price","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780620/","name":"Peter S. programme.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats
Człowiek, który gapił się na kozy
The Men Who Stare at Goats
programme.desc:
The Men Who Stare at Goats: Directed by Grant Heslov. With George Clooney, Ewan McGregor, Jeff Bridges, Kevin Spacey. A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1234548/","name":"The Men Who Stare at Goats","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIwOTQwNzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODc4MDU4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1234548/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"C-Younkin"},"dateCreated":"2009-11-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Younkin Reviews Movies","reviewBody":""The Men Who Stare at Goats" is a fascinating subject that gets the "Saturday Night Live" treatment. It's all based on fact (from Jon Ronson's book) but the concept is so silly that director Grant Heslov and George Clooney (both worked on "Good Night, and Good Luck) really can't help but make fun of it, and there are some good laughs here. Just no real story.

Ewan McGregor plays journalist Bob Wilton, a jilted husband who goes to war to forget his backstabbing wife only to end up wiling away in Kuwait. One night he meets Lyn Cassidy (George Clooney), a familiar name to him from a previous interview he did years before about psychic-spies. Lyn was the best in what was called the "New Earth Army", started by Vietnam-Vet Bill Django (Jeff Bridges) in the 80's to create soldiers with super-powers who could prevent conflict. The Army was later dismantled and used for evil purposes by the movie's antagonist Hooper (Kevin Spacey) but Lyn tells Bob he's been re-activated, and has a secret mission to do in Iraq. Bob, thinking Lyn crazy but interesting at the same time, decides to team up with him and go where the action is. Along the way, Lyn tells him stories of others dubbed, "Jedi Warriors." 

Most of the movie is flashbacks, beginning with Iraq War 2003 and chronicling all the way back to the beginning of New Age warfare. There are weird and crazy laughs to be had like Lyn's initiation, where Django urges him he will never be a soldier unless he can free the dance. The lines are good too. "We tried invisibility but then worked it down to just not being seen", Lyn tells Bob upon their first meeting. Clooney is perfectly eccentric as a guy who lives by the mindfulness-over-warfare principal and McGregor is a whiny, but solid straight-man. Bridges is also terrific as this free-spirited hippie. Only the laughs and flashbacks (which feel like a series of sketches) aren't enough to distract from the fact that "Goats" really has no compelling narrative. The forward-moving story in Iraq 2003 has very little momentum. Spacey appears later on again as the villain but the conflict is weak and the movie has more than over-stayed its welcome.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130167,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"2009-11-06","keywords":"satire,army training,iraq war,secret military operation,goat","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Paranormal Activity -- "Paranormal Goats" TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi309003545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzI0OTM0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDgwMDg5Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzI0OTM0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDgwMDg5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A TV trailer for the movie Paranormal Activity."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000191/","name":"Ewan McGregor"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000228/","name":"Kevin Spacey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381416/","name":"Grant Heslov"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104115/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0184096/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740160/","name":"Jon Ronson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1661186/","name":"Peter Straughan"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rocky II
Rocky 3
Rocky III
programme.desc:
Rocky II: Directed by Sylvester Stallone. With Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire, Burt Young, Carl Weathers. Rocky struggles in family life after his bout with Apollo Creed, while the embarrassed champ insistently goads him to accept a challenge for a rematch." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079817/","name":"Rocky II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGFjMTdmOTktNTJkNi00YWM2LTgzZjYtOWVkMTUyMGNjZDUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMwNDgzNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Rocky struggles in family life after his bout with Apollo Creed, while the embarrassed champ insistently goads him to accept a challenge for a rematch.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079817/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kezop_male"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Same Story, Both Continued AND Re-told","reviewBody":"I'm old enough to remember the thrill of seeing each of the "Rocky" films during their original, theatrical runs. The magical component that Stallone achieved was to tell nearly the exact same story, twice in a row, with the same characters... and yet, he gives us a one-two punch that hits just solidly as the first.

It's truly a remarkable feat. Differences? We've already met all the characters. Gone is the sense of discovery, the sense of learning who these people are. We already know, don't we? Yet, Stallone's characters are sufficiently interesting enough for us to want to spend more time with them, seeing them in a world most of us don't know, living a life few of us would really want. While the sense of discovery about these characters is gone, our joy of being a voyeur into their world is not.

It's a toss up which movie, "Rocky" or "Rocky II," asks us to suspend disbelief more. In "Rocky," we have to accept that a nobody, unrated, club fighter could a) get the chance to fight the world champion. B) He could possibly defy all odds and go the distance. That's a huge stretch only possible in Hollywood movies, classifying the first movie as a fairy tale along the lines of Cinderella.

Soap opera-esquire is not a bad way to characterize "Rocky II" because of the emotional ride, but I don't find it as trite as a soap opera. Rocky's actions are very believable, from his earnings feeling like a fortune to him (when they were obviously not), to his illiteracy and his unsophisticated, "punch drunk" boxer. The ramifications of his past are believable. He fritters away the money and is unable to capitalize on his 15 minutes of fame. Hey, it happens all the time. Very believable.

With a pregnant wife, no job, and no way to pay his bills, he's backed into a corner. What's a fighter to do? (And in this case, I mean "a fighter" in its most literal sense.) He's willing to risk his health and even his marriage to do what any man should do: provide for his family.

Adrian's bit of drama is the single "problem" with the movie, but it's also the heart of the movie. It's not a movie about losing it all and coming back again, it's much more than that. It's about a simple man who's trying to do the best he can with the only tools he has. And when Adrian is first to go down for the count, it puts it all in jeopardy.

It's not until his wife is ready to accept him as he is, for what he is, that he can continue his quest, one more fight, for his family, for himself.

The story arc feels so similar to the first movie that this one is often tossed to the side, yet it truly is amazing how Stallone managed to re-imagine all the magic of the first movie and, better still, give us a second helping of it that's just as sweet. Enjoy!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":200561,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"1979-06-15","keywords":"rocky balboa character,adrian character,paulie character,rocky balboa jr character,mickey goldmill character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rocky II","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2087782169","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI5MjQ4YmEtMGVhNC00ZTYxLWEzNTctN2YzNTJiODg1OGY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI5MjQ4YmEtMGVhNC00ZTYxLWEzNTctN2YzNTJiODg1OGY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Rocky II"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001735/","name":"Talia Shire"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0949350/","name":"Burt Young"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054262/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
G.I. Joe: Czas Kobry
G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc:
G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra: Directed by Stephen Sommers. With Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje, Christopher Eccleston, Grégory Fitoussi, Joseph Gordon-Levitt. An elite military unit comprised of special operatives known as G.I. Joe, operating out of The Pit, takes on an evil organization led by a notorious arms dealer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1046173/","name":"G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzMTU1NzQwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDg4NzMzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An elite military unit comprised of special operatives known as G.I. Joe, operating out of The Pit, takes on an evil organization led by a notorious arms dealer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1046173/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ichabod81"},"dateCreated":"2009-08-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Delivers exactly what it promises and that's the point.","reviewBody":"Please, take note that I rated this film 8 only because of it's value as an action film, but that's exactly the point I came here to get across. Everybody seems to have the same argument when they trash this film.. "it's all effects and no brains or dramatic undertones". OK, that is true, I've got to admit, but then again what kind of movie were these people actually expecting to see? Huh?! 

G.I. Joe is as pure as an action film can possibly be and most importantly, it doesn't pretend to be anything else. Look at the poster. Check out the trailer. After those, were you perhaps waiting to see an Ingmar Bergman film? IT'S G.I. JOE, for Christ's sake! And I must say that in it's category, it isn't that bad. Sommers can direct good action sequences (the pursuit on the streets of Paris is stunning!) and although the film is obviously overblown with ridiculous gadgets and over the top plot lines, it doesn't matter because Joe succeeds in it's ONLY primary mission: to be entertaining. It's never boring and it's the silly fun it was always going to be.

So in a nutshell.. if you want a serious film to watch, check out There Will Be Blood or Doubt, but if you just want to forget for two hours the mess your leaders have left your nation, nay, the *world* and just have fun, check out this action film. Thank you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":205276,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-09-23","keywords":"gi joe,swat team,2000s,destruction,iceberg","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"G.I. Joe"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000598/","name":"Dennis Quaid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005541/","name":"Marlon Wayans"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0814085/","name":"Stephen Sommers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031181/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064181/","name":"Stuart Beattie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0254213/","name":"David Elliot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1749087/","name":"Paul Lovett"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ocaleni
Passengers
programme.desc: Terapeutka Claire Summers (Anne Hathaway) zajmuje się osobami cudem ocalałymi z katastrofy lotniczej. Przebieg wypadku, który poznaje z relacji pacjentów, znacznie odbiega od oficjalnej wersji zdarzeń. Wkrótce jej podopieczni zaczynają znikać w tajemniczych okolicznościach. Claire podejrzewa, że odpowiedzi na nurtujące ją pytania zna Eric (Patrick Wilson), z którym ma romans.

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 6782276, Title: The Padre, --- Description: The Padre: Directed by Jonathan Sobol. With Tim Roth, Nick Nolte, Luis Guzmán, Juana Arboleda. Retired Judge Randall and his hired gun, Gaspar, track down a con man posing as a priest in a small Colombian town only to be thrown off-course by a scrappy 16-year-old girl intent on reuniting with her sister in the United States." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6782276/","name":"The Padre","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmRiZTBmMGYtZjQwMy00NmJlLWE2ZDktZTA3MWU2MDcwMDViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MTUzMjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Retired Judge Randall and his hired gun, Gaspar, track down a con man posing as a priest in a small Colombian town only to be thrown off-course by a scrappy 16-year-old girl intent on reuniting with her sister in the United States.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6782276/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"larrys3","dateCreated":"2018-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lacks Dramatic Tension & Suspense","reviewBody":"Set in Colombia, Tim Roth portrays a pickpocket and conman disguised as a padre, as he tries to escape the pursuing ex-Marshal Nick Nolte, who believes Roth was responsible for the death of his pregnant daughter. Nolte has hired Luis Guzman, a local police officer, to help him in this pursuit and to smooth things over when Nolte disrespects the local populace or their customs. Finally, Valeria Henriquez is quite engaging as the young charmer Lena, who is desperate to join her sister in Minnesota (sold online to a family when they were both in a church orphanage) and will even team up with the "padre" to get there.\n\nWith this good cast and storyline I guess I expected more from this movie, but it lacked dramatic tension and suspense and came across as too flat-toned. Overall, it just never seemed to gel into anything substantial, as I see it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1515,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-09-28","keywords":"girl","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Padre","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi181189401","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWI4NzM0OGEtY2ZhMi00MmY4LWExZGEtOWYzYWQ0MTYzZWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWI4NzM0OGEtY2ZhMi00MmY4LWExZGEtOWYzYWQ0MTYzZWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000619/","name":"Tim Roth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000560/","name":"Nick Nolte","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350079/","name":"Luis Guzmán"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1038286/","name":"Jonathan Sobol"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133523/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053578/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3127634/","name":"Stephen Kunc"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

Paranormal Witness
programme.desc: Paranormal Witness: With Gillian English, Frances Townend, Daniel Cannis, Colin Murphy. A true horror documentary series which brings to life the stories of people who have lived through paranormal experiences that defy explanation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1874066/","name":"Paranormal Witness","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTZkZTQxZTEtN2VjYi00ZDg3LTlkZDAtMWIzMGNjODcwMzE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0NzcxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A true horror documentary series which brings to life the stories of people who have lived through paranormal experiences that defy explanation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1874066/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dsaillant811"},"dateCreated":"2012-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Horrifying","reviewBody":"This is one of the freakiest shows on TV, but before watching it, you need to know what you're getting into. This show DOES NOT try to prove or disprove the paranormal. Nor are the stories even slightly realistic. When you realize that, you will appreciate the show much more. I really don't like the 2-story episodes of season 1. Season 2 is a lot better. Season 2 is all-around stronger, better, and scarier. There are plenty of jump scenes and loads of suspense. This is probably the best "Haunted Documentary" style show on TV. Some episodes are just pure junk, but the "Man in the Attic," "Capitol Theater Haunting," and "The Dybbuk Box" are by far the freakiest and most jumpy episodes.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2595,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"genre":["Documentary","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2011-09-07","keywords":"haunting,poltergeist,two word title,eyewitness account,documentary series","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7025791/","name":"Gillian English"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3266807/","name":"Frances Townend"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3141457/","name":"Daniel Cannis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0178419/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Paranormal Witness","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3941252377","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGVkMWY4N2YtM2Y2Zi00OGRiLTkwNDUtOWIxZWM4ZDdkMGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGVkMWY4N2YtM2Y2Zi00OGRiLTkwNDUtOWIxZWM4ZDdkMGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Paranormal Witness"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Snowmageddon
Śnieżny Armagedon
Snowmageddon
programme.desc:
Snowmageddon: Directed by Sheldon Wilson. With David Cubitt, Laura Harris, Dylan Matzke, Magda Apanowicz. An Alaskan town is in danger of destruction by a mystical snow globe that appears on a family's doorstep, wrapped like a Christmas gift, and causes deadly "natural" disasters in the real world, while simultaneously occurring in the globe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1876446/","name":"Snowmageddon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDJkNGFiYTctNmRmMi00Mzc3LWJiZWYtN2RhNDkyZWFjYTBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"An Alaskan town is in danger of destruction by a mystical snow globe that appears on a family's doorstep, wrapped like a Christmas gift, and causes deadly "natural" disasters in the real world, while simultaneously occurring in the g","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1876446/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Another case of the not terrible but not good either sort of movie","reviewBody":"As I have said many times already I have made no secret of disliking a lot of SyFy's films, but I do keep watching to see if they do come up with something that is watchable at least. They have done a few movies that are surprisingly tolerable though even they are far from perfect, but most are bad but you are amused by the awfulness or are like witnessing a train-wreck.

I was very mixed on Snowmageddon actually, of the above categories it sits between the tolerable and so bad it's good ones. I do give it plaudits for the better than average acting, granted it is not brilliant but it is award-worthy compared to the likes of Quantum Apocalypse and Titanic II, decent photography and a storyline that is mostly interesting and original in concept.

That is not to say that the story is perfect though. It is interesting and generally well paced, but it does take a while to get going and the ending is abrupt. There are also scenes and ideas that suspend disbelief and don't make much sense, but for the first time in a while I actually got some novelty value out of them. These are including the ideas that electricity is still flowing in a town that is cut off from the rest of the world, flying even with ice bombs are going off and nobody in the town carrying a knife.

Snowmageddon also has some amateurish effects-though I've seen worse-, cheesy dialogue and characters that aren't developed enough to make us care for them. I loved the title, but it didn't fit with the concept and story, it was like there had been a last minute title change or that they had thought of a new idea and forgot to think of a title that fitted.

Overall, not as bad as other SyFy efforts, but there is nothing really that stood out to make it memorable or good. 4/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1159,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2011-12-10","keywords":"disaster film,globe,christmas,snow,the family","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190931/","name":"David Cubitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364977/","name":"Laura Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3676866/","name":"Dylan Matzke"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934135/","name":"Sheldon Wilson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0337940/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0998149/","name":"Rudy Thauberger"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

These are including the ideas that electricity is still flowing in a town that is cut off from the rest of the world, flying even with ice bombs are going off and nobody in the town carrying a knife.

Snowmageddon also has some amateurish effects-though I've seen worse-, cheesy dialogue and characters that aren't developed enough to make us care for them. I loved the title, but it didn't fit with the concept and story, it was like there had been a last minute title change or that they had thought of a new idea and forgot to think of a title that fitted.

Overall, not as bad as other SyFy efforts, but there is nothing really that stood out to make it memorable or good. 4/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1159,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2011-12-10","keywords":"disaster film,globe,christmas,snow,the family","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190931/","name":"David Cubitt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364977/","name":"Laura Harris","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3676866/","name":"Dylan Matzke"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934135/","name":"Sheldon Wilson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0337940/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0998149/","name":"Rudy Thauberger"],"duration":"PT1H29M"</script><metacontent="

Skinwalkers
programme.desc:
Skinwalkers: Directed by James Isaac. With Jason Behr, Elias Koteas, Rhona Mitra, Natassia Malthe. A 12 year old boy and his mother become the targets of two warring werewolf packs, each with different intentions and motives." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0461703/","name":"Skinwalkers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1OTIyNzc5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjI1ODI1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A 12 year old boy and his mother become the targets of two warring werewolf packs, each with different intentions and motives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0461703/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"verypickymoviegoer"},"dateCreated":"2007-08-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Disappointing Film","reviewBody":"Here is an example of a film trying to be more than what it is. If only it stuck to all action and special effects instead of trying to develop characters and drama. Because of the introduction of a plot and the constant in your face force feeding of hollow characters, I must take the review to go beyond what I wanted it to be. 

The special effects were really cheesy and made the film seem like a very low budget movie. There are a lot of plot holes. The acting was bad to mediocre. It is very hard to try to feel a bond or sympathy with the characters.

Summary: Those who watch for torture and gore will hate the film. Those who watch for drama and complex characters will hate the film. Those who watch for special effects will hate the film. Those who watch for pure action might enjoy half of the film. Those who watch for groundbreaking unique horror movies will hate the film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13288,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2008-04-09","keywords":"transformation,12 year old,half breed,werewolf,desert eagle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Skinwalkers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3632464153","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxYzk2NzUtNDBmOC00YTkxLWE4MjQtOGRjMTA4NWIxMWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxYzk2NzUtNDBmOC00YTkxLWE4MjQtOGRjMTA4NWIxMWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Lionsgate"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004736/","name":"Jason Behr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000480/","name":"Elias Koteas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593961/","name":"Rhona Mitra"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0410494/","name":"James Isaac"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0097422/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0218621/","name":"James DeMonaco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1029960/","name":"Todd Harthan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734442/","name":"James Roday Rodriguez"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Godsend
Godsend
programme.desc:
Godsend: Directed by Nick Hamm. With Greg Kinnear, Rebecca Romijn, Robert De Niro, Cameron Bright. A couple agree to have their deceased son cloned, under the supervision of an enigmatic doctor, but bizarre things start to happen several years after his rebirth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0335121/","name":"Godsend","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzNzE3MTg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTIxNDYwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple agree to have their deceased son cloned, under the supervision of an enigmatic doctor, but bizarre things start to happen several years after his rebirth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0335121/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rob_Taylor"},"dateCreated":"2004-07-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not one to see twice, even with the cloning element.","reviewBody":"I guess this film didn't really grip me. You knew from the start where the film was heading, but it seemed to take its sweet time about getting there. Perhaps that's why I found myself nodding off several times, only to be awoken by the obligatory, and repeated use of, shock tactics throughout the film.

I can't really think of anything positive to say about this film, but neither can I say anything greatly negative. It was neither good, nor bad. In fact, watching it was very much like being trapped in limbo. There was little to stimulate the audience's minds through most of the movie.

It's also irritating to see Hollywood moralising about the evils of cloning through the use of film. I'd hesitate to say it was right, but the last thing reasoned debate on the subject needs is idiot screenwriters cashing in on public fears (and fears that are generated by media misrepresentation, at that) and adding more fuel to the fire. What next, a movie about people turning into flies because they ate genetically modified food crops?

This film isn't very good and you won't be seeing it twice even if you do have the foolishness, like me, to watch it once. IMDb data; ttnr: 0335121, Title: Godsend, --- Description: Godsend: Directed by Nick Hamm. With Greg Kinnear, Rebecca Romijn, Robert De Niro, Cameron Bright. A couple agree to have their deceased son cloned, under the supervision of an enigmatic doctor, but bizarre things start to happen several years after his rebirth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0335121/","name":"Godsend","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzNzE3MTg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTIxNDYwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple agree to have their deceased son cloned, under the supervision of an enigmatic doctor, but bizarre things start to happen several years after his rebirth.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0335121/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Rob_Taylor","dateCreated":"2004-07-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not one to see twice, even with the cloning element.","reviewBody":"I guess this film didn't really grip me. You knew from the start where the film was heading, but it seemed to take its sweet time about getting there. Perhaps that's why I found myself nodding off several times, only to be awoken by the obligatory, and repeated use of, shock tactics throughout the film.

I can't really think of anything positive to say about this film, but neither can I say anything greatly negative. It was neither good, nor bad. In fact, watching it was very much like being trapped in limbo. There was little to stimulate the audience's minds through most of the movie.

It's also irritating to see Hollywood moralising about the evils of cloning through the use of film. I'd hesitate to say it was right, but the last thing reasoned debate on the subject needs is idiot screenwriters cashing in on public fears (and fears that are generated by media misrepresentation, at that) and adding more fuel to the fire. What next, a movie about people turning into flies because they ate genetically modified food crops?

This film isn't very good and you won't be seeing it twice even if you do have the foolishness, like me, to watch it once. Lets just hope that this is one film that Hollywood decides NOT to clone in the future.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":25413,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2004-11-24","keywords":"bare chested boy,barefoot boy,camera shot of bare feet,birthday,boy","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Godsend","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2410283289","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgwYzhlMzEtOTAyNy00MzQyLTlmODMtNTA1YjYzODk1MTA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgwYzhlMzEtOTAyNy00MzQyLTlmODMtNTA1YjYzODk1MTA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001427/","name":"Greg Kinnear","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005381/","name":"Rebecca Romijn"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0358327/","name":"Nick Hamm"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060306/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024601/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005596/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0093560/","name":"Mark Bomback"],"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Die Enterprise ist zu Besuch auf der Raumstation Deep Space Nine. Bei einem Experiment mit dem Stationsarzt Dr. Bashier erleidet Data einen Plasmaschock. Als er wieder zu sich kommt, verfügt er über sonderbare Erinnerungen in seinem Speicher. Worf erhält unterdessen von einem Yridianer eine schockierende Nachricht: Sein totgeglaubter Vater soll in einem romulanischen Lager gefangen gehalten werden.
